name: Honey Mustard Chicken with Roasted Veg and Fluffy Couscous
description: Tender honey mustard chicken and tray-roasted vegetables served over lemony couscous. Mild, fast, and family-friendly.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C (425°F). Line a large sheet pan.
Cut broccoli into small florets; slice carrots into 1 cm rounds; halve and slice zucchini into half-moons.
Cut chicken thigh fillets into bite-size pieces.
Zest the lemon, then cut it in half and juice it.
Bring 2 cups of vegetable stock to a boil.
Measure couscous into a heatproof bowl.
cook_steps: On the sheet pan, toss broccoli, carrots, and zucchini with 1 tbsp olive oil, a pinch of salt, and pepper. Spread out and roast for 12–15 minutes.
In a bowl, mix chicken thigh fillets with honey mustard, 1 tbsp olive oil, a pinch of salt, pepper, and half the lemon juice.
Remove the tray, push vegetables to the sides, and add the chicken to the center in a single layer. Return to the oven and roast 10–12 minutes until chicken is cooked through.

While the chicken roasts, pour the hot vegetable stock over the couscous. Cover and let stand 5 minutes, then fluff with a fork. Mix in lemon zest, a drizzle of olive oil (optional), and a pinch of salt to taste.
Serve couscous in bowls, top with roasted vegetables and chicken. Squeeze over remaining lemon juice and sprinkle chopped parsley if using.

Serve couscous in bowls, top with roasted vegetables and chicken. Squeeze over remaining lemon juice and sprinkle chopped parsley if using.
